info.title: Nearby API
info.description:
Nearby Places API, enables you to add discovery and search of nearby POIs by searching for a generic keyword used to describe a category of places or via the unique code assigned to that category.

The MapmyIndia Nearby API Platform provide following features:

  • Nearby Search(Generic)
  • Custom Code Nearby Search
  • POD Filter Nearby Search

New Feature(s):

  • `Filter`


Filter

We are introducing this new parameter to do more specific search using `key:value` pair(s) (e.g. cat_code:ABC123).

  • Each `key:value`pair is seperated by a seperator`,`
    *(e.g. filter=cat_code:abc123,mac_plug_type:PN3)*.

  • We can use two or more `values` for a `key` by putting either `OR(;)` or `AND($)` operator
    *(e.g. cat_code:abc123;xyz123,mac_plug_type:PN3&PN2)*.

  • By default `key:value` pairs are treated as `AND($)` case.

Suppose you want to search all electric vehical charging station of a particular brand*(e.g. "Honda" )* and of a particular plug type *(e.g. "PN3")* then you can use filter as:

*(filter=cat_code:EVSTAN,brand_id:HONDAV,mac_plug_type:PN3)*

where EVSTAN is category code for EV station, HONDAV is brand_id for Honda and PN3 is plug type.

Keys: *"cat_code", "brand_id", "partner_id", "mac_plug_type".*

Note(s):

  • `keys` & `values` are dynamic in nature.
  • `,` This is used as an example operator to explain query.


Custom Category Codes

This will enable custom category code based nearby searching for customers*(e.g. Honda, HDFC)*.The search can be performed on the basis of either custom category code or MMI category codes or keywords. The output contains standard fields and a richInfo object for client-specific data. The RichInfo can have dynamic response parameters as per customer's requirement. This can be enabled on the basis of configuration provided at the time of onboarding customer's data.

POD

Introducing "pod" parameter to search for villages. This parameter accepts "vlg" as value. The radius for village provides the range of distance. The radius for village search is 50 KM fixed.

Operators

To send multiple keywords in a request, we’ve defined a couple of operators that can help the developers wrap their applications around this functionality. Below are the operators:

  • The `;` Operator: This operator is an `OR` operator. Defining multiple keywords separated with a `;` would provide results that satisfies either of the keywords.\
  • The `$` Operator: This operator is an `AND` operator. Defining multiple keywords separated with a `$` would provide results that satisfy all the provided keywords. (default).
  • The `,` operator: This operator is a seperator for using two or more `key:value` pairs and it has functionality of `AND($)` operator.

To use these operators, simple just send in the keywords parameter like below:
*&keywords=coffee;tea$sea food;alcohol*
The above nearby search would yield in results that either provide coffee or tea but must provide either sea food or alcohol.


Security Type:

This APIs follow OAuth2 based security. To know more on how to create your authorization tokens, please click the `Authorize` button below. More details available here

  • Live Demo
  • Login/Sing Up for API key and other access.


    Other Info(s)

    • URLs: the urls to use for UAT and Prod are: https://atlasweb.mapmyindia.in/api/v3.5/places/nearby/json? and https://atlas.mapmyindia.com/api/places/nearby/json?
    • For any issues or questions please submit it to the support : API Support if you do not have access to the support portal contact your service account manager with any questions.

    Example request:

    https://atlas.mapmyindia.com/api/places/nearby/json?keywords=coffee;beer&refLocation=28.631460,77.217423

parameters.name: Keywords
parameters.description: Generic keywrods search like FODCOF, Shoes, Coffee, Versace, Gucci, H&M, Adidas, Starbucks, B130 (POI, House Number, keyword, tag)

parameters.name: refLocation
parameters.description: Provides the location around which the search will be performed

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: provides number of the page to provide results from

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: provides configured sorting operations for the client on cloud. Below are the available sorts

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: provides the range of distance to search over (default 1000, min, 500, max, 10000)

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: (x1,y1,x2,y2) Allows the developer to send in map bounds to provide a nearby search of the geobounds. where x1,y1 are the lat lng of

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: it takes in the country code. LKA, IND, BTN, BGD, NPL for Sri-Lanka, India, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Nepal respectively. Default is India (IND)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: *key:value* pair to specified our seach.(e.g. For all honda EV stations: *filter=cat_code:EVSTAN,brand_id:HONDAV*, where EVSTAN is category code and HONDAV is brand_id for Honda)

204.description: No matches we’re found for the provided query

400.description: Something’s just not right with the request
